intro: Senecio pycnanthus, commonly known as the densehead groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters at the tips of its stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland or shrubland habitats. Senecio pycnanthus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
